utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey? Are you in there?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh God! That’s Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, you have to talk to her!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no, I can’t! I can’t! Not after the other night, it’s just it’s…too weird, okay? Don’t tell her I’m here! Don’t eat that!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Is Joey here?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t see him. Do you see him?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don’t see him. Hey! Maybe he’s in the sugar bowl! Joey? Nope!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, at least you make each other laugh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I haven’t seen him since that night that he told me how he y’know… I don’t know, I think he’s avoiding me. Why is that bagel on the floor?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We were playing a game.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ew, was Chandler naked? Sort of like a, like a ring toss kind of situation?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?! No! No!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right. Well listen, if you see Joey will you just tell him uh…tell him I miss him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, did you hear that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, a naked bagel game? Dude, I don’t know. That’s a pretty small hole.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, you gotta talk to her.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can’t! Y’know? You guys don’t know what it’s like to put yourself out there like that and just get shot down.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t know what that’s like?! Up until I was 25 I thought the only response to, "I love you," was, "Oh crap!"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello? No rejection? I got shot down at fat camp! Boy, kids are mean when they’re hungry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right so, so what do I do?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This is Rachel. I mean, what are you gonna do, never going to talk to her again? I mean I know it’s weird, it’s awkward, but you gotta at least try.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay. Whoa! I almost forgot this was on your…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We didn’t play it!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, so when you’re done with your tea I’ll look at your leaves and tell you your fortune.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I didn’t know you read tea leaves.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I’ve done it for years. I actually stopped because I was so accurate. Y’know, and-and y’know, one of the great joys of life is it’s-it’s wondrous unpredictability. Y’know? And also tea tends to give me the trots.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I’m done. Read mine.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Ooh, I see a ladder. Which can mean either a promotion or a violent death.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I-I’m the head chef. I-I can’t get promoted.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-hmm. Uh-hmm, who’s next?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, I’m done. Do mine.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Umm, oh! Okay, I see a circle.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Which can either mean you’re having a baby or you’re gonna make a scientific discovery!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I have been spending a lot of time in the lab.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What does yours say Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm… Wow, all right. Wow! Yay! Ooh, I’m gonna meet a guy! And really soon! And he’s gonna be the man of my dreams. Probably not the guy I had a dream about last night.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! Has anyone seen my shirt? It’s a button down, like a, like a faded salmon?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You mean your pink shirt?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Faded salmon color.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, I-I haven’t seen your pink shirt.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Great! Great. Then I must’ve left it at Mona’s. I knew it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I’m sure you get another one at Ann Taylor’s.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s my favorite shirt! Okay? I love that shirt!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well just ask Mona to give it back!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know. I mean I-I guess I could. It’s just that we didn’t really end things such good terms. And if I go over there I’d be ignoring the one thing she asked me to do when we broke up, jump up my own ass and die.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh wait a second you guys…for the last couple weeks I’ve been that guy everywhere I go. We take the same bus. We go to the same bookstore, the same dry cleaners; maybe he’s the tea guy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Phoebe, did you see that?! He totally checked you out! He is so cute! Mine has a picture of The Village People, what does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Tea gives Phoebe the trots.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So I thought Joey and I would be okay once we hung out, but it’s not even like we know how to be with each other anymore.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know it’s tough now, but things will get better.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How do you know that? What if it just gets worse and worse and worse, to the point where we can’t even be in the same room with each other?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m not great at the advice, can I interest you in a sarcastic comment? Some cheese?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, what is the Bruce Springsteen CD in the Kat Stevens case?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let’s just say if I can’t find the right CD case I just put it in the nearest one.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, where is the Kat Stevens CD?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: In the James Taylor case.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Where is the James Taylor CD?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey, I’m gonna save you some time, 200 CDs, not one of them in the right case.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. No need to panic. Deep breathes everyone. Okay umm uh, we’re just gonna have to spend some time and put the CDs in the right cases.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, if we’re gonna do that we should come up with some kind of order. Y’know alphabetically or by genre?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hmm, I don’t know. We really have to talk this through.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God!! You guys have such problems!! I feel so terrible for you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I-I’m sorry. You and Joey, your both focusing on this uncomfortable thing, what you need to do is to change the subject. Next time you see him try to get him talking about something else.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah. That makes sense.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, like I don’t know, maybe you have a work problem that you need his advice on.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, I can do that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Good. Uh honey, the Miami Vice soundtrack? Really?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: They were just giving those away at the store in exchange for money.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh I really don’t know what to tell you Rach, I really don’t. I mean, maybe Joey can help you out with your, with your big work problem.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah Joey she’s…Rachel’s got this really big work problem, and it is a head scratcher. Wow! Y’know what, if we’re gonna make dinner we’re gonna have to leave. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So you uh, have a…big work problem?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah it’s umm… Yeah it’s uh… It-it’s y’know—It’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Huh. Okay. So uh, I think I’m gonna take off.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah—No wait! Joey no wait it is. It’s something. It’s-it’s umm…it’s my boss.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, and umm my baby.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: My boss wants to buy my baby!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?! Oh my-oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know I told you, it’s a really big problem.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What he wants to buy your baby?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Can you believe that?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s crazy!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s what I told him!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, how did this even happen?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well I’ll tell ya! See uh my-my boss and his wife—They-they can’t have children. So umm, and that—we were at the Christmas party, and he got drunk, and he said to me, "Rachel, I want to buy your baby."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Man! When you said it was a problem about your boss and the baby I figured it was something about maternity leave.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh! Yeah! Yeah that-that would’ve been a much simpler problem.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh hello.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Oh, it’s you. I see you everywhere. I’m Jim, Jim Nelson.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh Jim, Jim Nelson I’m Phoebe, Phoebe Buffay. We certainly have been seeing a lot of each other lately.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: We have. Maybe we’ll be seeing each other at dinner tomorrow night, say around 8 o’clock?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, maybe we will. Oh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mona? Okay, if I were a salmon shirt, where would I be?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: I am so sorry I spilled wine all over your shirt.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: No, it’s still wet. Y’know what? Let me get it out before it sets. Ooh, I have something you can wear. Here.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: No-no that’s a man’s shirt.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God, honey we are so meant to be together. We both have copies of the Annie soundtrack.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, both yours.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! Great advice on that Joey thing!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah? The work problem?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh it was perfect! I mean it really felt like he was my friend again.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What problem did you tell him you had?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh that’s not important. The point is, I really—I think everything’s gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: May I help you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Do you think you can just buy my friends baby?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Isn’t it funny how we kept running into each other? It’s as if someone really wants us to be together.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: Someone does. Me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, witty banter. Well done.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: So, tell me a little bit about yourself.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh okay, well I’m a masseuse, and I used to work at this place…

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: Do you like to party?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I-I-I like, I like parties.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: You’re wild, aren’t ya?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah I guess, a little.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: It ain’t no thing, I’m wild too.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So! Umm, anyway I-I lived in New York, someone wildly I guess, for umm—Well since I was fourteen.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’m staring. It’s just that you have the most beautiful eyes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh stop it.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: And your breasts! Hmm!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Umm look, you’re coming on a little strong. But I’m going to give you the benefit of the doubt, because it seems the universe really wants to be together. So, why don’t we just start over okay? And you can just tell me about yourself.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: I write erotic novels, for children.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: They’re wildly unpopular.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: Oh also, you might be interested to know that I have a Ph.D.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! You do?

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: Yeah, a Pretty Huge…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The sun’ll come out…tomorrow! Bet…your bottom dollar that tomorrow… …there’ll be sun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! Oh Joey, honey listen, thank you for talking to my yesterday about that thing with my boss. That really meant a lot.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Not a problem. Oh, and just so you know, that guy’s not going to be bothering you about that baby thing anymore.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Let’s just say I took care of it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa, let’s say more!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Don’t worry! Don’t worry. I just told him, very nicely, "You don’t go buying people’s babies, so back off!!"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler and Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! No, no-no-no Joey he doesn’t want to buy my baby! I made that up!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?! Why?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So that we would have something to talk about! So it wouldn’t be awkward!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And you couldn’t think of anything else?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You said your boss wants to buy your baby?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can’t believe that you yelled at my boss! I’m-I’m gonna lose my job! What am I going to do?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You can always sell your baby.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Joey, I can’t believe you brought my boss into this! I’m gonna get fired!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You lied to me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, she told me too!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler has two copies of Annie!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh my God! Ross!!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello!!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Ross, what are you doing?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not touching myself if that makes anyone less uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Morning. You wanted to see me?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: Please, come in. Have a seat.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay look Mr. Zelner…

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: Oh I think it’s best that I speak first.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: I’ve asked Lee from human resources to be here as a witness to our conversation.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: If I in any way implied that I wanted to buy your baby…I am sorry. Okay? Last week when I asked you when your due date was uh, I certainly did not mean that I felt that I was due your baby. Yeah, I want to be very clear that I understand that its your baby, and it is not mine to purchase.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, as long as we are clear about that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh there it is.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s not your regular dry cleaners.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know, but that creep that I went on that date with goes to there so I have to find a new one. I also have to find a new video store, a new bank, a new adult bookstore, a new grocery store…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: A new grocery store. The universe said I was going to meet a nice guy and that’s what they gave me? When I get up there I’m going to kick some ass.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Don’t worry Phoebe, you’re gonna meet someone. If I can meet a great guy, so can you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, we both can. And we both will.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, you didn’t have to come in with me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you kidding? This is where they get out stains! Okay? This is like Disneyland for me. I’m-I’m gonna be over here watching the dance of the clean shirts.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Oh, excuse me! I think you dropped s… Wow!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: I’m sorry, it’s just that you’re so incredibly beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah well, I’m sorry about that too, but what are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: I hope you don’t think I’m crazy but I feel like I was meant to pick this up, do you believe in that kind of thing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: A little. Now you’re talking.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Would you like to go out and have a cup of coffee?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I-I-I’d love to. Let me just tell my friend.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ooh, an ink stain! Hey, can I watch how you get this out?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She must’ve left.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So? What-what-what happened?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s all gonna be okay. They’re just so happy that I’m not suing them that they gave me one extra month paid maternity leave. So long as I understand that the money should not construed as a down payment on this or any other child I should bear.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow, Ralph Lauren is really going out of there way to show they’re not in the baby buying business.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, can you give us a minute?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh I’m sorry, you’re kicking me out of my own living room?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’ll be in there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, I’m really sorry that I lied to you. I was just trying to make things…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know. I know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It kinda worked. I mean y’know, I don’t know about you buy I haven’t thought about our thing since all this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey you’re right. Yeah, it’s kinda been like us again a little bit.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah I know! I miss that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Me too. I mean I…haven’t thought at all about how I put myself out there and said all that stuff and how you didn’t feel the same way about me and-and how it was really awkward.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: My gynecologist tried to kill me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Item J437-A, color: winterberry. Hi umm, listen come here, come in. I’m so-so sorry about yesterday. I-I’m really sorry. It’s just that I…

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Listen Ross, you don’t have to apologize. I understand why you were there.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Yeah, you still have feelings for me. And-and to be honest, I-I still have feelings for you. And I wish that we can work it out Ross, but we can’t. It’s too complicated with you and Rachel and the baby, I-I just… It just wasn’t meant to be.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh God you’re right.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Ross, we…we have to be strong. Okay, I-I’m gonna go. Can I? To remember you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.
